DataElement.preferredName: Bone Marrow Transplantation Cancel Patient Neutrophil Count Platelet Count Recovery Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indication of if a patient had to cancel a bone marrow transplant due to count recovery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bone Marrow Transplantation Cancel Patient Neutrophil Count Platelet Count Recovery
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A procedure to replace bone marrow that has been destroyed by treatment with high doses of anticancer drugs or radiation. Transplantation may be autologous (an individual's own marrow saved before treatment), allogeneic (marrow donated by someone else), or syngeneic (marrow donated by an identical twin)._Postpone indefinitely or annul something that was scheduled._Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures._A test to determine the number of neutrophils in a sample of blood._The determination of the number of platelets in a blood sample, usually expressed as platelets per cubic millimeter (cmm) of whole blood._A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure to replace bone marrow that has been destroyed by treatment with high doses of anticancer drugs or radiation. Transplantation may be autologous (an individual's own marrow saved before treatment), allogeneic (marrow donated by someone else), or syngeneic (marrow donated by an identical twin).:Postpone indefinitely or annul something that was scheduled.:Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Concepts.definition: A procedure to replace diseased bone marrow with transplanted healthy bone marrow cells.
Postpone indefinitely or annul something that was scheduled.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Property.preferredDefinition: A test to determine the number of neutrophils in a sample of blood.:The determination of the number of platelets in a blood sample, usually expressed as platelets per cubic millimeter (cmm) of whole blood.:A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.

Concepts.definition: A test to determine the number of neutrophils in a sample of blood.
The determination of the number of platelets in a biospecimen.
A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did a prolonged ANC or platel
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did a prolonged ANC or platelet count recovery in the absence of protocol therapy of more than 50 days contribute to bone marrow transplant cancellation?
